bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to Howard A. Kelly, October 23, 1906

div1.p: Carroll forwards to Kelly his account of the autopsy of the first fatal case in his yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to Howard A. Kelly, October 23, 1906

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
October 23d 1906.

div1.p:
I take
pleasure in enclosing,
for your perusal, my
letter containing my
account of the post
mortem examination of
the first fatal case of
experimental yellow fever.

I shall have to order
some more photographs
and as soon as they are
received I will send
you one or more if you
desire them.
